usefulItems: baking paper and baking beans, tart tin (Ø 22 cm), oven, refrigerator
title: Milk Tart

preparations.content: Preheat oven to 180°C and grease a tart tin (Ø 22 cm).
Place butter and sugar in mixing bowl then cream <b>10 sec/speed 5<b>.

Add flour, egg, baking powder and salt then mix <b>10 sec/speed 4<b>. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula then mix again <b>10 sec/speed 4<b>. Transfer to prepared tin, pushing evenly into base and up sides using fingertips (see tip). Prick base with a fork, line with baking paper and fill with baking beans. Blind bake for 10 minutes (180°C). Remove baking beans and paper then bake for a further 5 minutes (180°C) or until lightly browned around the edges. Meanwhile, clean mixing bowl and make filling.
Place flour, sugar, milk, cornflour and egg in mixing bowl then mix <b>10 sec/speed 5<b>. Cook <b>15 min/90°C/speed 4<b>.
Add butter and vanilla extract then mix <b>5 sec/speed 4<b>.
Pour into baked crust and leave to cool slightly then sprinkle generously with cinnamon. Place in fridge overnight then serve chilled.

hintsAndTricks: The crust may shrink a little during baking. To avoid the tart case becoming too small, push pastry up a little beyond the edge of the tin.
